experiment.name: FNAL_15FT
experiment.exp_info:
FNAL-E-0632 (May 1985 - Feb. 1988). Spokespersons: Douglas R.O. Morisson, Michael W. Peters. The main aim is an exploratory search for new particles and effects in a new energy range. Also studies like-sign dileptons and neutral current interactions using the Internal Picket Fence to identify such events. Other topics include coherent effects, strange particle production, etc. Uses three conventional cameras with 500-micron resolution and a high resolution holographic optical system with 100-micron resolution in the central part of the chamber.
FNAL-E-0545 (28 Jun. 1978 - 17 Jan. 1979), spokesperson: G.S.Snow Evolved from FNAL-151 and -227. Uses the emi. Took 317 KPX in the wide-band neutrino beam with one horn and a proton energy of 350 GeV.
FNAL-E-0388 (24 Jun. 1977 - 12 Sep. 1979), spokesperson: V.Z.Peterson Dichromatic beam incident on Ne-H2 fill. Momenta given here are for 300 and 400 GeV protons. Took 181 KPX.
FNAL-E-0045 (? - 13 Jan. 1976), spokesperson: F.A.Nezrick Momentum given here indicates range of usable neutrino flux. Took 162 KPX.
FNAL-E-0031 (? - 13 Aug. 1977), spokesperson: M.Derrick Topics studied include the neutral-to-charged-current ratio, properties of the hadronic system, rho0 production, scaling in fragmentation, etc. Momenta given here indicate range of usable flux. Took 211 KPX.
Fermi National Accelerator Lab (FNAL) 15-foot Bubble Chamber Hydrogen - Deuterium - Neon
1978 - 1993 nu_mu - nu_mu_bar 1- 600

experiment.name: SKAT
experiment.exp_info:
SERPUKHOV-107 (Feb. 1976 - 1987). Spokesperson: V.V.Ammosov. Studies neutral current processes, neutrino-electron scattering, charm decays, and dilepton production. Some 500,000 pictures (2*10**18 protons on target) were obtained in a numu wide-band beam, and about 300,000 (1.5*10**18 protons on target) in a numubar wide-band beam.
Serpukhov
Heavy Freon

experiment.name: CDHS
experiment.exp_info:
CERN-WA-001 (17 May 1979 - 22 Dec. 1983) spokesperson: J.Steinberger Studies inclusive neutrino reactions in iron, including rare processes such as multilepton production, and compares neutrino interactions in hydrogen and iron.

experiment.name: CCFR
experiment.exp_info:
FNAL-E-701 (? - 14 Jun. 1982), spokesperson: M.Shaevitz Measures the change in neutrino flux with distance by detecting the numbers of charged current events in two detectors at different distances. Ran for 2250 hours.
FNAL-E-0770 (1987 - 1 Feb. 1988), spokesperson: W.H.Smith Uses iron target, scintillators, and flash ADC calorimeter drift chamber readout. A continuation of FNAL-744. Ran for 1600 hours.
Fermi National Accelerator Lab (FNAL)

experiment.name: CHARM
experiment.exp_info:
CERN-WA-018 (? - Dec. 1983). Spokesperson: K.Winter Both narrow and wide band beams are used. Measures total cross sections and x and y distributions of neutral and charged current interactions. Several rare processes have been seen. This apparatus follows behind that of experiment WA-001, and part of this experiment is to measure the polarization of mu+s produced in that one (these latter reactions have Fe as target). The upgraded detector incorporates 78 planes of streamer tubes.
CERN-WA-018-2 (? - 3 Sep. 1984). Spokesperson: K.Winter A high-precision measurement of the ratio of neutral and charged currents on an isoscalar target to determine the electroweak mixing (sin-theta)**2.
CERN-WA-079 (Aug. 1986 - 12 Aug. 1991). Spokesperson: K.Winter The experiment aims at determining the electroweak mixing angle Theta(W) and the ratio g(A)/g(V) from the ratio of neutrino-electron and antineutrino-electron scattering cross-sections. The obtained values are to be compared to those determined with 10**6 times larger Q**2 at LEP. CHARM-II neutrino detector consists of a massive, fine-grained, and low-density electronic calorimeter, followed by a muon spectrometer made of magnetized iron, with scintillators and drift chambers as active elements. The measurements are performed in the horn-focused wide-band neutrino beam.
CERN
Marble (CaCO3), Glass
